TOP STORIES

Australian hospital group Healthscope rejected two takeover approaches, including the one by Brookfield Asset Management Inc , and said it will instead explore selling its properties, in what analysts called a risky move that could invite a more favorable takeover bid.

May 22 (Reuters) - Stock futures pointed to a higher opening for Canada’s main stock index on Tuesday as oil prices rose toward $80 per barrel on concerns about declining Venezuelan output and a possible fall in Iranian exports.
The Toronto Stock Exchange’s S&P/TSX rose 18.76 points, or 0.12 percent, to 16,162.31 on Friday, extending its recent streak of higher closes to an 11th day.
ET, while S&P 500 e-mini futures rose 0.19 percent and Nasdaq 100 e-mini futures were 0.42 percent higher.
Dow Jones Industrial Average e-mini futures were up 0.24 percent at 7:15 a.m.
June futures on the S&P TSX index were up 0.25 percent at 7:15 a.m.
Canadian markets were closed on Monday for Victoria Day.
Wholesale trade data for March is due at 8:30 a.m.
ET and is expected to show a rise of 0.6 percent.
